DOC.brief_summary: This study offer first formal assessment sexual violence ( SV ) college student health center setting , develop high risk group college student , design facilitate patient provider comfort discuss sexual violence relate abusive experience ( include role alcohol ) via semi-scripted screening tool . The intervention specifically involve train clinical staff ( health educator , counselor , medical assistant , nurse , clinician ) deliver universal education brief counsel intervention title GIFTSS ( Giving Information Trauma Support Safety ) client seek college health service integrate usual clinical practice , provide universal education SV regardless disclosure , counsel client harm reduction strategy reduce risk SV , provide support referral sexual assault advocate , goal reduce SV among college student .
DOC.brief_title: College Health Center-based Alcohol Sexual Violence Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: This stakeholder-engaged longitudinal study test , via 2-armed cluster randomize controlled trial , brief harm reduction intervention reduce risk sexual violence among male female college student age 18-24 receive care college student health service ( K = 24 college ; baseline N = 2200 ) . Sexual violence ( SV ) ( include sexual coercion , non-consensual sexual contact , rape ) common among college woman , three quarter woman sexually assault report first experience occurred age 25 . Alcohol-related SV , particular , highly prevalent college campus , half sexual assault case occur context victim and/or perpetrator intoxication . Multiple pathways implicate association alcohol SV , social norm regard alcohol consumption expectation SV facilitate occurrence underreporting violence . College student health center remain untapped set reach youth SV prevention intervention . This study draw several intervention study investigative team , integrate successful component : 1 ) bystander approach individual teach skill active interveners SV prevention rather respond apathy tolerance effective strategy promote change within social context ; 2 ) universal education SV regardless disclosure clinical set result increase recognition SV use relevant service ; 3 ) harm reduction strategy introduce clinician increase intention use strategy help oneself friends increase safety . The brief counseling intervention use palm-size educational card information SV harm reduction give patient clinical encounter . GIFTSS ( Giving Information Trauma Support Safety ) provide ( ) patient education assessment regard SV ; ( b ) discussion harm reduction behavior reduce risk SV self peer ( include bystander intervention ) ; ( c ) support referral victim service . Interventions effective reach college-age young adult either witness experience SV need . College student health center randomize GIFTSS intervention arm receive training brief intervention integrate routine college health visit . The control sit receive brief alcohol intervention . Compared control , male female client receive GIFTSS intervention expect great recognition constitutes SV alcohol-related sexual risk ( primary outcome ) , recognition sexual coercion , self-efficacy obtain sexual consent , self-efficacy enact harm reduction strategy , intention intervene , knowledge self-efficacy use SV-related service ( Aim 1 ) . Among participant witness peer SV , receive GIFTSS likely report intervention interrupt peer 's harmful behavior ( Aim 2 ) . Clients SV victimization history receive GIFTSS expect likely disclose SV clinic visit , report great use SV-related service , report le recent SV victimization follow compare control client ( Aim 3 ) .
